title: Anagram package
text: anagram package offers suite functionalities designed handle various tasks related anagrams. Anagrams, words formed rearranging letters another word phrase, present interesting challenges linguistic analysis word manipulation. package addresses challenges providing tools anagram detection, subset analysis, frequency visualization.

title: Anagram package
text: dataset used anagram package comprises data frame 333,333 observations 2 variables: Word: Character vector containing English words. Frequency: Numeric vector representing frequency count word corpus. dataset serves foundation identifying anagrams determining relative frequencies.

title: Anagram package
text: can access dictionary dataset using following code:
code: # Load the anagram package library(anagram)  # Access the dictionary dataset data("dictionary")

title: Anagram package
text: 1.Anagram Checker are_anagrams function anagram package efficiently determines whether given set words anagrams . validates input, normalizes character cases, compares character distributions ascertain anagram relationships. Additionally, offers flexibility analyze subsets words anagram patterns. Features: Validates input character vector ensures non-empty input. Normalizes character cases removes non-alphabetic characters consistent comparison. Detects anagrams comparing character counts word. Offers option analyze subsets words anagram relationships. Output: function returns TRUE words input vector anagrams , FALSE otherwise. subset analysis, function provides insight whether combination words within subset forms anagrams. 2.Anagram Subset Analysis anagramsubset_function designed check whether subset words contains anagrams , considering combinations characters specified minimum length. achieves generating combinations characters specified length word comparing combinations identify anagrams within subset. Features: function first defines three internal helper functions: count_chars: Counts occurrences character word. are_anagrams: Determines whether two words anagrams comparing character counts. generate_combinations: Generates possible combinations characters specified length word. Example 1, subset contains words (“right” “tight”) anagrams , considering combinations characters least length 4. Therefore, function returns TRUE. Example 2, subset contain pairs words anagrams , considering combinations characters least length 3. Therefore, function returns FALSE. 3. Enhanced Anagram Detection Frequency Analysis function anagramfinder_function creates S3 object containing list words found given dictionary contain specific subset letters present input word. S3 object also includes frequency information word found, enabling detailed analysis visualization. output can easily manipulated visualized using provided methods printing plotting. print.anagram_output method used display output anagramfinder_function user-friendly format. shows input word, number matches found, matches along frequencies. plot.anagram_output method visualizes relative frequencies matches found anagramfinder_function. provides users graphical representation data, making easier interpret.  example, ’re searching anagrams word “alter” provided dictionary. output show words found along relative frequencies, allowing us analyze visualize results. generating matches among words containing subset letters input word using anagramfinder_function, ’s often valuable identify word appears frequently within subset. most_common_word function comes play. most_common_word function extracts common word matches found input word. particularly useful discerning word holds highest frequency within subset words generated anagramfinder_function. function calculates common word among matches found input word within anagram_output object. identifies word highest frequency within subset returns significant word. example, illustrate usage most_common_word function input word “alter.” First, use anagramfinder_function generate matches among words containing subset letters “alter,” based provided dictionary. Next, apply most_common_word function extract common word among matches. output example “later,” indicating “later” common word among matches found input word “alter.” demonstrates most_common_word function efficiently identifies word highest frequency within subset words generated anagramfinder_function
code: # Check if multiple words are anagrams are_anagrams(c("aligned", "dealing", "leading")) #> [1] TRUE  # Check for anagrams within subsets are_anagrams(c("care", "race", "hello", "world"), subsets = TRUE) #> [1] FALSE # Example 1: Subset contains anagrams subset1 <- c("tiger", "right", "tight") anagramsubset_function(subset1, min_length = 4)   #> [1] TRUE  # Example 2: Subset doesn't contain anagrams subset2 <- c("hello", "world", "hi") anagramsubset_function(subset2, min_length = 3)  #> [1] FALSE # Load the dictionary data data(dictionary)  # Search for anagrams of the word "alter" in the dictionary output <- anagramfinder_function("alter", dictionary)  # Print the anagrams found print(output) #> Input word: alter  #> Matches found: 13  #>         Word Frequency #> 944    later  84857974 #> 2450   alert  32472727 #> 7413   alter   7831337 #> 21020  letra   1468238 #> 56036  altre    274062 #> 65519  relat    208840 #> 164813 taler     42377 #> 170839 trael     39723 #> 203385 artel     29896 #> 220718 realt     26373 #> 288753 ratel     16306 #> 290005 retal     16174 #> 295371 treal     15628  # Plot the relative frequencies of the anagrams. plot(output) # Generate matches among the words containing a subset of letters from the input word "alter" output <- anagramfinder_function("alter", dictionary)  # Extract the most common word among the matches common_word <- most_common_word(output)  # Print the most common word print(common_word) #> [1] "later"

title: Authors and Citation
text: Amrita Jena. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Jena (2024). anagram: Comprehensive Anagram Detection Analysis. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://github.com/Advanced-R-Programming/assignment-3-package-completion-ajen0022.
code: @Manual{,   title = {anagram: Comprehensive Anagram Detection and Analysis},   author = {Amrita Jena},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://github.com/Advanced-R-Programming/assignment-3-package-completion-ajen0022}, }

title: Comprehensive Anagram Detection and Analysis
text: “anagram” package introduces innovative approach anagram detection incorporating frequency information core functionality. feature enhances package’s utility providing insights relative occurrence anagrams within corpus words. considering frequency word corpus, package allows users analyze prevalence significance different anagrams, thus facilitating nuanced linguistic investigations. addition frequency-aware capabilities, “anagram” package offers essential functionalities anagram detection within words. Initially, verifies whether two given words anagrams, ensuring share identical letters arranged differently. Furthermore, package extends capabilities check anagrams within group words identify anagram subsets within specified subset words, considering combinations characters specified minimum length. versatile tool, designed straightforward linguistic analysis, accepts character vector words input efficiently discerns anagram relationships, catering various user needs.

title: Comprehensive Anagram Detection and Analysis
text: can install development version anagram GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("numbats/assignment-3-package-completion-ajen0022")

title: Comprehensive Anagram Detection and Analysis
text: example, demonstrate usage anagramfinder_function finding anagrams word “” using provided dictionary. print plot output visualize relative frequencies found anagrams.

title: Comprehensive Anagram Detection and Analysis
text: output anagramfinder_function S3 object, common data structure R. S3 objects allow organizing data structured formats associated methods manipulation analysis. case, anagram_output class encapsulates results Anagram Finder function, providing convenient access matched words frequencies.
code: library(anagram)  # Call the anagramfinder_function output <- anagramfinder_function("that", dictionary)  # Print the output print(output) #> Input word: that  #> Matches found: 5  #>        Word  Frequency #> 10     that 3400031103 #> 68714  taht     191717 #> 107765 hatt      86981 #> 244037 thta      22068 #> 312336 htat      14109  # Plot the output plot(output)

what: Check if Two Words are Anagrams
title: Comprehensive Anagram Detection and Analysis
text: example demonstrates use are_anagrams check two words anagrams . case, check given examples anagrams . output TRUE, indicating “alert”,“alter” “later” indeed anagrams . second example “listen ”silent” anagrams “hello” “world” anagrams output shows FALSE.
code: library(anagram) ## Check if two words are anagrams of each other words <- c("alert", "alter", "later")  are_anagrams(words) #> [1] TRUE     # Example 2: Checking for anagrams within subsets  words <- c("listen", "silent", "hello", "world")  are_anagrams(words, subsets = TRUE) #> [1] FALSE

title: Comprehensive Anagram Detection and Analysis
text: example illustrates use anagramsubset_function find anagram subsets minimal length within set words. , find anagram subsets length 3 within words “tiger”, “right”, “tire”, “grit”, “git”, “rite”. output boolean value (TRUE case), indicating whether anagram subsets meeting specified minimum length requirement found within specified set words. functions provide convenient way work anagrams, whether ’re testing words anagrams finding anagram subsets within set words.
code: library(anagram)  ## Find anagram subsets of minimal length within a set of words words <- c("tiger", "right", "tire", "grit", "git", "rite") min_subset_length <- 3 anagram_subsets <- anagramsubset_function(words, min_subset_length) print(anagram_subsets) #> [1] TRUE

title: Comprehensive Anagram Detection and Analysis
text: Please note project released Contributor Code Conduct. participating project agree abide terms.

what: anagram: Comprehensive Anagram Detection and Analysis — anagram-package
title: anagram: Comprehensive Anagram Detection and Analysis — anagram-package
text: "anagram" package offers versatile set tools anagram detection, analysis, visualization. Users can explore words dictionary contain specific subset letters, enriched output including frequency information detailed analysis visualization. package also enables determination whether set words anagrams facilitates identification anagrams within subsets words. functionalities empower users delve linguistic patterns, word relationships, frequency distributions ease precision.

title: anagram: Comprehensive Anagram Detection and Analysis — anagram-package
text: Maintainer: Amrita Jena ajen0022@student.monash.edu (ORCID)

what: Anagram Finder with Frequency Information — anagramfinder_function
title: Anagram Finder with Frequency Information — anagramfinder_function
text: function creates S3 object containing list words found dictionary specific subset letters, along relative frequency. output can printed plotted visualize relative frequencies output words. dictionary frequency information present extension.

title: Anagram Finder with Frequency Information — anagramfinder_function
code: anagramfinder_function(word, dictionary)

title: Anagram Finder with Frequency Information — anagramfinder_function
text: word input word. dictionary data frame containing dictionary words.

title: Anagram Finder with Frequency Information — anagramfinder_function
text: S3 object class 'anagram_output'.

title: Anagram Finder with Frequency Information — anagramfinder_function
code: # Search for anagrams of the word "listen" in the dictionary output <- anagramfinder_function("listen",dictionary) # Print the output print(output) #> Input word: listen  #> Matches found: 7  #>          Word Frequency #> 1891   listen  43252527 #> 5152   silent  12768385 #> 32537  enlist    695738 #> 45786  inlets    386963 #> 55663  tinsel    277040 #> 163091 intels     43053 #> 201446 teslin     30386 # Plot the output plot(output)

what: Check anagram subset with minimum character length — anagramsubset_function
title: Check anagram subset with minimum character length — anagramsubset_function
text: function checks whether subset words contains anagrams ,considering combinations characters specified minimum length.

title: Check anagram subset with minimum character length — anagramsubset_function
code: anagramsubset_function(words, min_length = 1)

title: Check anagram subset with minimum character length — anagramsubset_function
text: words character vector containing words checked. min_length integer specifying minimum length combinations characters consider. Default 1.

title: Check anagram subset with minimum character length — anagramsubset_function
text: TRUE subset contains anagrams , FALSE otherwise.

title: Check anagram subset with minimum character length — anagramsubset_function
code: # Example 1: Subset contains anagrams  anagramsubset_function(c("tiger", "right", "tight"), 4) #> [1] TRUE  # Example 2: Subset doesn't contain anagrams anagramsubset_function(c("hello", "world", "hi"), 3) #> [1] FALSE

what: Test if a set of words are anagrams of each other — are_anagrams
title: Test if a set of words are anagrams of each other — are_anagrams
text: function determines whether set words anagrams . Anagrams words contain letters may arranged differently. function takes character vector words input checks share set letters, indicating anagrams.

title: Test if a set of words are anagrams of each other — are_anagrams
code: are_anagrams(words, subsets = FALSE)

title: Test if a set of words are anagrams of each other — are_anagrams
text: words character vector containing words tested. subsets Logical indicating whether check anagrams within subsets words. Default FALSE.

title: Test if a set of words are anagrams of each other — are_anagrams
text: TRUE words anagrams , FALSE otherwise.

title: Test if a set of words are anagrams of each other — are_anagrams
code: # Example 1: checking if multiple words are anagrams words <- c("actors", "costar", "castor") are_anagrams(words) #> [1] TRUE  # Example 2: Checking for anagrams within subsets words <- c("alert", "alter", "hello", "world") are_anagrams(words, subsets = TRUE) #> [1] FALSE

title: Dictionary Dataset — dictionary
text: dictionary dataset contains list words corresponding frequencies. row represents word, 'Frequency' column indicates often word appears corpus. dataset commonly used text analysis natural language processing tasks.

title: Dictionary Dataset — dictionary
code: data(dictionary)

title: Dictionary Dataset — dictionary
text: data frame 333333 observations 2 variables: Word character vector representing words. Frequency numeric vector representing frequency word.

title: Dictionary Dataset — dictionary
text: https://norvig.com/ngrams/count_1w.txt

title: Dictionary Dataset — dictionary
text: dataset contains list words corresponding frequencies. serves dictionary various text processing tasks. dataset sourced : https://norvig.com/ngrams/count_1w.txt

what: Find the most common word among the anagrams — most_common_word
title: Find the most common word among the anagrams — most_common_word
text: most_common_word function extracts common word matches found among anagrams. specific method defined class input object, default method called, raises error. title: Find the most common word among the anagrams — most_common_word

title: Test if more than two words are anagrams of each other — multiplewords_function
code: # Example 1: checking if multiple words are anagrams words <- c("alert", "alter", "later") multiplewords_function(words)  # TRUE #> [1] TRUE  # Example 2: # Error handling example # Providing non-character input tryCatch({   multiplewords_function(123) }, error = function(e) {   cat("An error occurred:", conditionMessage(e), "\n") }) #> An error occurred: Input 'words' must be a character vector.
